title: Influenza vaccines promote humoral and cellular immune responses: a randomized, double-blind, phase 3 trial.
abstract: Annual vaccination is an effective strategy for preventing severe disease caused by seasonal influenza. Quadrivalent influenza vaccines (QIVs) protect against two strains of influenza A and two strains of influenza B, thereby enhancing the host antiviral neutralizing antibody response and inducing CD4
